stories.text: I'm curious about those DNA test companies that say they will check for a bunch of diseases you may be susceptible to. It certainly sounds very tempting to be able to get in front of some serious condition you may encounter later in life. Has anyone here had a particularly positive experience with a DNA test?
stories.title: Ask HN: Have you done a DNA test for health? Did it reveal anything useful?
Could search engines be fostering some Dunning-Kruger?
Show HN: Zenmode â€“ don't let other apps distract you

stories.text:
I currently have a few app ideas and am unsure which one is likely to be more commercially successful.

I would like to do some initial validation and use a quantifiable metric to determine which app to build out an MVP for.

I was considering making a landing page for each idea and then using Facebook ads to drive traffic and then building out the idea with the most sign ups.

Does anyone else have any processes they use to compare app ideas and get hard data on which idea to build into a product?
stories.title: Ask HN: How to decide which idea to build into an app
